title: voc2vec: A Foundation Model for Non-Verbal Vocalization Processing
author: Alkis Koudounas (Politecnico di Torino), Moreno La Quatra (Kore University of Enna), Sabato Marco Siniscalchi (Universita degli Studi di Palermo), Elena Baralis (Politecnico di Torino), ...
relevance_why: This work presents a new model specifically for processing non-verbal audio, which could inform methodologies in audio generation and manipulation tasks in Haohe's research on text-to-audio generation and audio quality enhancement.
background: The task involves classifying various non-verbal vocalizations such as laughter and crying using a specialized deep learning model pretrained on diverse audio datasets.
contribution: This paper introduces voc2vec to solve the challenge of non-verbal sound classification, achieving improved performance over existing models on several benchmark datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models primarily focused on speech recognition or generic audio classification, often ignoring the nuances of non-verbal vocalizations, especially in emotional contexts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by leveraging a specialized dataset and a tailored model architecture to better capture the acoustic and contextual features of non-verbal sounds.

key_innovation: Voc2vec utilizes an architecture combining convolutional neural networks and transformers specifically designed for understanding non-verbal human vocalizations.
real_world_impact: By enhancing the understanding and classification of non-verbal human sounds, this model could significantly benefit fields such as mental health monitoring or early childhood development.
limitations: The performance may still be constrained by the diversity and size of the training datasets.

new_terms.voc2vec: **Voc2vec** is a novel foundation model developed for processing and classifying non-verbal human vocalizations, utilizing self-supervised learning techniques.
new_terms.self-supervised learning: **Self-supervised learning** is a type of machine learning where the model learns representations from unlabeled data by creating supervisory signals from the input itself.

open_sourcing: Pre-trained models and training scripts are available at https://github.com/koudounasalkis/voc2vec
